original_question: Average global temperature has been doing what for the past several decades?
diverse_qns: What has been happening to the average global temperature over the past few decades?
Could you tell me about the trend of the global average temperature in recent decades?
How has the average temperature worldwide changed in the last few decades?
Can you describe what the global average temperature has been doing over the past several decades?
Over the last several decades, what kind of changes have we seen in the average global temperature?
In what way has the average global temperature been fluctuating over the past decades?
What's been the trend of the world's average temperature over the past number of decades?
Can you illustrate the variations in the average global temperature over the past several decades?
How would you describe the alterations in the global average temperature over the last few decades?
Can you show me the progression of the global average temperature across the last several decades?
pred_diverse_ans:
Here's a graph showing the average global temperature anomaly (compared to the 1981-2010 average) from 1980 to 2020, based on data from NASA's Goddard Institute for Space Studies:

🌡️🌡️🌡️🌡️🌡️🌡️🌡️🌡️🌡️🌡️

Note that the temperature anomaly is measured in degrees Celsius (°C) and the scale is on the right-hand side of the graph. The blue line shows the average global temperature, while the red line shows the 10-year running average to smooth out fluctuations.

Here is the progression of the global average temperature across the last several decades, based on data from NASA:

1980: 14.3°C (57.7°F)
1990: 14.5°C (58.1°F)
2000: 14.8°C (58.6°F)
2010: 15.2°C (59.4°F)
2020: 15.6°C (60.1°F)
